title: Basic Styling in React
subject: React
theory:
## Making it Pretty
There are many ways to style React apps.

### 1. External CSS
Import a `.css` file in your JS. Usage: `className="myClass"`.

### 2. Inline Styles
Pass a JavaScript object to the `style` prop. Properties are camelCased.
`style={{ backgroundColor: 'blue', fontSize: '20px' }}`

### 3. CSS Modules
Scope CSS to the component to avoid naming conflicts. `import styles from './Button.module.css'`. Usage: `className={styles.btn}`.

common_mistakes.correction: `style="color: red"` fails. Must be an object `style={{ color: 'red' }}`.

exam_notes: CSS Modules prevent global scope pollution.
summary: React supports all standard CSS methods, but CSS-in-JS solutions are also popular.
